turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What the heck, Jerry, if I wanted bank interest on seven hunnert'n fifty thousand I'd go to Midwest Federal. Talk to Bill Diehl.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: He's at Norstar.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: He's at -

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: I gotta tell ya, Wade, I'm leanin' to Jerry's viewpoint here.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well -

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: We gotta protect Jean. These - we're not holdin' any cards here, Wade, they got all of 'em. So they call the shots.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: I'm tellin' ya.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well... Why don't we...

turns.speaker: ANGEL FACE
turns.text: That wouldn't interest you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where's Tyler?

turns.speaker: ANGEL FACE
turns.text: The first rule of Project --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right, right.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What... ?

turns.speaker: ANGEL FACE
turns.text: The garden.  Take him there.  Move, people.  Let's do this!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get your hands off him!  Get off...! What the hell do you think you're doing... ? Evidence?!  This is a man... !  You killed him!

turns.speaker: ANGEL FACE
turns.text: He was killed in action.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!  Look at you!  You're... you're running around in ski masks, exploding things...

turns.speaker: ANGEL FACE
turns.text: He was killed serving Project Mayhem.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I need to know where Tyler is.  Can't you help me?

turns.speaker: BANDAGED PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Sir, you're disturbing the other patrons with your laudish behavior.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's no one else here.

turns.speaker: BANDAGED PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I'm sorry, I haven't the faintest idea what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look at my face.  I'm a member.  I just need to know if you've seen Tyler Durden.

turns.speaker: BANDAGED PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I'm not disclosed to bespeak any such information to you, nor would I, even if I had said information you want, at this juncture be able.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You are a moron.

turns.speaker: BANDAGED PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I'm afraid I have to insist you leave.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This was a support group for men with testicular cancer.  The big moosie slobbering all over me was Bob.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We're still men.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.  We're men.  Men is what we are.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Six months ago, Bob's testicles were removed.  Then hormone therapy.  He developed bitch tits because his testosterone was too high and his body upped the estrogen.  That was where my head fit -- into his huge, sweating tits that hung enormous, the way we think of God's as big.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: They're gonna have to open my pec's again to drain the fluid.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bob was a champion bodybuilder.  You know that chest expansion program you see on TV?  That was his idea.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: ...using steroids.  I was a juicer. Diabonol, then, Wisterol -- it's for racehorses, for Christsake.  Now I'm bankrupt, divorced, my two grown kids won't return my calls...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Strangers with this kind of honesty make me go a big rubbery one.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Cornelius!  How are you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bob.  I'm okay.  How are you?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Better than I've ever been in my life.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Really?  Great.  Still "Remaining Men Together?"

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No.  I found something new.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Really, what's that?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: The first rule is... you aren't supposed to talk about it...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: And the second rule about it is... you're not supposed to talk about it. And the third rule...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bob, Bob... I'm a member.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You are?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look at my face.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That's a fucking great, man!  Fucking great! Congratulations.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, both of us.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You know about the guy who invented it? I hear all kinds of things. Supposedly, he was born in a mental institution.  They say he only sleeps one hour a night.  You know about this guy?  Tyler Durden?

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: I'm going to need you out-of-town a little more this week.  We've got some "red-flags" to cover.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It must've been Tuesday.  he was wearing his "cornflower-blue" tie.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You want me to de-prioritize my current reports until you advise of a status upgrade?

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: You need to make these your primary "action items."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He was full of pep.  Must've had his grande latte enema.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: Here are your flight coupons.  Call me from the road if there are any snags.  Your itinerary...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: After fight club, everything else in your life gets the volume turned down.  You can deal with anything.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: Have you finished those reports?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: Is that your blood?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Some of it, yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I must've left the original in the copy machine.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: "The second rule of fight club... Is this yours?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hmm?

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: You don't get paid to abuse the copy machine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: "Abuse" the copy machine.  There's an image.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: Pretend you're me.  You find this. What would you do?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We need to talk.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: Okay.  Where to begin?  With your constant absenteeism?  With your unpresentable appearance?  You're up for review...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I Am Jack's Complete Lack of Surprise.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's pretend.  You're the Department of Transportation, and you discover that our company intentionally did nothing about leather seats cured in third world countries with chemicals we know cause birth defects?  Brake linings that fail after a thousand miles.  Fuel injectors that burn people alive.

turns.speaker: BOSS
turns.text: Just who the fuck do you think you are?!  Get out!  You're fired!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What about this?  Keep me on payroll as an outside consultant.  In exchange for my salary, I'll keep my mouth shut.  I won't need to come to the office.  I can do this job from home.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: This is Detective Stern with the arson unit.  We have some new information about the "incident" at your condo.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: I don't know if you're aware... your front door -- it seems someone sprayed freon into the lock, then tapped it with a chisel to shatter the cylinder.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I wasn't aware...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I am Jack's Cold Sweat.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: Does this sound strange to you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes, sire, strange.  Very strange.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: The dynamite...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Dynamite?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: Yes.  It left a residue of ammonium oxalate and potassium perchloride. Do you know what that means?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: It means it was homemade.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is... really a shock...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: Whoever set this homemade dynamite could've blown out the pilot light days before the explosion.  The gas, it seems, was just a detonator.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who do you think could've done this?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: I'll ask the questions, son.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  No, sir.  I loved that condo. I loved every stick of furniture. The lamps, the chairs, the rugs, were me.  The dishes were me.  The plants were...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'd like to thank the academy...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE STERN
turns.text: Well, if any ideas come to you, give me a call.  In the meantime, don't leave town.  I may need to bring you in for questioning.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: No, you can't die of insomnia.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe I died already.  Look at my face.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: You need to lighten up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can't you give me something?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Red-and-blue Tuinal, lipstick-red Seconals.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: You need healthy, natural sleep. Chew valerian root and get some more exercise.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm in pain.

turns.speaker: INTERN
turns.text: You want to see pain?  Swing by First Methodist Tuesday nights.  See the guys with testicular cancer.  That's pain.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We need to talk.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm on to you.  You're a faker.  You aren't dying.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay, in the Sylvia Plath philosophy way, we're all dying.  But you're not dying the way Chloe is dying.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: And I saw you practicing this...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Practicing what?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Telling me off.  Is it going as well as you hoped... ?  "... Mr. Taylor."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll expose you.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Go ahead.  I'll expose you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: It's cheaper than a movie, and there's free coffee.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: These are my groups.  I was here first.  I've been coming for a year.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: A year?  How'd you manage that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Anyone who might've noticed either died or recovered and never came back.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I... I don't know.  I guess... when people think you're dying, they really listen, instead...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: -- Instead of just waiting for their turn to speak.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It becomes an addiction.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, I can't cry with a faker present.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Candy-stripe a cancer ward.  It's not my problem.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please.  Can't we do something... ?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll split up the week.  You can have lymphoma, tuberculosis and --

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You take tuberculosis.  My smoking doesn't go over at all.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think testicular cancer should be no contest.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Well, technically, I have more of a right to be there than you.  You still have your balls.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I don't know -- am I?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I'll take the parasites.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You can't have both parasites.  You can take blood parasites --

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I want brain parasites.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.  I'll take blood parasites and organic brain dementia --

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I want that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You can't have the whole brain!

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: So far, you have four and I only have two!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then, take blood parasites.  It's yours.  Now we each have three.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: So, we each have three -- that's six. What about the seventh day?  I want ascending bowel cancer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The girl had done her homework.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: That's your favorite, too?  Tried to slip it by me, eh?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll split it.  You get it the first and third Sunday of the month.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Looks like this is goodbye.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's not make a big thing out of it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Um... Marla, should we maybe exchange numbers?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Should we?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In case we want to switch nights.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I suppose.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Where have you been the last few weeks?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How did you find me?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: The forwarding number.  I haven't seen you at any support groups.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's the idea -- we split them.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You haven't been going to yours.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I found a new one.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's for men.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Like testicular cancer?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, this is a bad time...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I've been going to debtor's anonymous.  You want to see some truly fucked up people?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm just on my way out...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Me too.  I got a stomach full of Xanax.  I took what was left of a bottle.  Might've been too much.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Picture yourself watching Marla Singer throw herself around her crummy apartment.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: This isn't a for-real suicide thing. This is probably one of those cry-for- help things.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This could go on for hours.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So you're staying in tonight?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Do you want to wait to hear me describe death?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What... ?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What the hell are you doing here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Except for their humping, Tyler and Marla were never in the same room.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I got this dress at a thrift store for one dollar.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Worth every penny.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Like sex crime victims, underwear inside-out, bound with electrical tape.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It suits you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's time for you to leave.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Don't worry, I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You're such a nutcase, I can't even begin to keep up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Would you do something for me?  I need you to check and see if there's a lump in my breast.  I can't afford to throw money away on a doctor.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know ...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She didn't call Tyler.  I'm neutral in her book.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is a sweet side of you.  Picking these up for ...  "Mrs. Haniver" and... "Mrs. Raines." Where are they?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Tragically, they're dead.  I'm alive and I'm in poverty.  You want any?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, thanks.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where?  Here?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Feel anything?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Make sure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay.  Okay, I'm sure.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You feel nothing?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Well, that's a relief.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No... no problem.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I wish I could return the favor.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think everything's okay here.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I could check your prostate.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh ... nah.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Well... thanks, anyway.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You... don't have to... leave.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Really... I mean it.  Have you been going to your groups?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Chloe's dead.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Do you care?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: It was the smart move on her part.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't understand.  Why does a weak person have to go out and find a strong person... to hang onto?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What do you get out of it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You hear that?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Hear what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That... sawing and hammering.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Have we been talking too long?  Must we change the subject?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: That day you came over to my place to play doctor... what was going on there?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What is this?  Who did this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... A person.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Guy or girl?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why would you ask if it's a guy or a girl?!

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Why would you get bent if I asked?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let go of me...  Leave me alone.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You're afraid to say.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Paper Street Soap Company.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's not here.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's not here!  Tyler's not here anymore!  He's gone away!

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla, it's me.  Have we... have we ever had sex?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What kind of stupid question is that?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because the answer's "yes" or because the answer's "no?"

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Is this a trick?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will you just answer me, for Christsake?!

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You mean, you want to know if I think we were just having sex or making love?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We did make love?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Is that what you're calling it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Answer the question!

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You fuck me, then snub me.  You love me, you hate me.  You show me your sensitive side, then you turn into a total asshole!  Is that a pretty accurate description of our relationship, Tyler?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We've just lost cabin pressure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What did you say... ?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Say my name.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What... ?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Say my name!  What's my name!?

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Tyler Durden!  Tyler Durden, you fucking freak.  What's going on?  I'm coming over there...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla, no, wait...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Your whacked-out, bald freaks hit me with a fucking broom.  I thought they were going to break my arm.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry, I...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: The were burning their fingertips with lye.  The stink was unbelievable.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla... I need to talk to you.  It's going to take a tremendous act of faith on your part for you to hear me out.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Here comes an avalanche of bullshit.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I don't want to hear anything you've got to say.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Give me a minute, Marla, alright... just sixty seconds.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Sixty seconds, then I'm out of here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Absolutely, you have every right.  I need you to do me a favor.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I've done you enough favors.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because... I'm Tyler Durden.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Then, I'll have the clam chowder... fried chicken and a baked potato with everything and a chocolate chiffon pie.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You got about thirty seconds.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know that I've been... unwell.  I know it's been like there's two sides to me.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Two sides?  You're Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Jackass.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I deserve that.  Anyway, I've... I've only just realized

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I mean, the depth and breadth of our relationship has only recently been illuminated for me.  I know this... I know us hasn't been such a great thing for you...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Whatever.  I'll take my food to go...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm trying to tell you -- and this is where you have to trust me -- but, I think your life might be in real danger.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You have to get out of here.  Leave as soon as possible.  Go to any rural town, away from any major city...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: You are an insane person.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Marla...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: No, no, shut up!  I've had enough. I tried, Tyler... I have tried...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: There's a part of you I really like, but I can't do this anymore.  I just can't.  This is killing me...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What?!  You're sorry?  I don't believe that for a minute.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Let go of me!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do this for me, Marla.  Do this for me, if you never do anything else...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Leave me alone!  I don't ever want to see you again!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay, if that's what it takes, you'll never have to see me again.  Here... here...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Tyler...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm begging you.  Get on the bus. Get on the bus.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can't let myself see where you're going.  Go wherever it takes you, remember... keep away from major cities...

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: I'm not paying this back.  I consider it "asshole tax."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes, fine.  Just, get on.  Stay away a couple of weeks, at least.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: What happened... ?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: My God, you're shot...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MARLA
turns.text: Who did this to you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I did, I think.  But, I'm okay... I'm fine...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: TYLER'S VOICE
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tyler?

turns.speaker: TYLER'S VOICE
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh... I'm sorry.  We met on the plane.  We had the same briefcase. I'm... you know, the clever guy.

turns.speaker: TYLER'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I just called a second ago.  There was no answer.  I'm at a payphone.

turns.speaker: TYLER'S VOICE
turns.text: I star-sixty-nined you.  I never pick up my phone.  What's up?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well... let me see... here's the thing...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... and you come home to this.

turns.speaker: TYLER'S VOICE
turns.text: You fucking slut!!

turns.speaker: WOUNDED BARTENDER
turns.text: How have you been?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... You know me?

turns.speaker: WOUNDED BARTENDER
turns.text: Is this a test, sir?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes... it's a test.

turns.speaker: WOUNDED BARTENDER
turns.text: You were in here last Thursday night.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WOUNDED BARTENDER
turns.text: You were standing right where you are now, asking how good our security is. It's tight as a drum.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who do you think I am?

turns.speaker: WOUNDED BARTENDER
turns.text: Is this part of the test?

turns.speaker: WOUNDED BARTENDER
turns.text: You're the one who did this to me. You're Mr. Durden, sir.  Tyler Durden.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please return your seatbacks to their full upright and locked position.

turns.speaker: SECURITY TFM
turns.text: Throwers don't worry about ticking. Modern bombs don't tick.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Excuse me?  "Throwers?"

turns.speaker: SECURITY TFM
turns.text: Baggage handlers.  But when a suitcase vibrates, the throwers have to call the police.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My suitcase was vibrating?

turns.speaker: SECURITY TFM
turns.text: Nine time out of ten, it's an electric razor.  But, every once in a while ...  ...it's a dildo.  It's airline policy not to imply ownership in the event of a dildo.  We use the indefinite aricle: "A dildo."  Never "Your dildo."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I had everything in that bag.  My C.K. shirts... my D.K.N.Y. shoes...

turns.speaker: SECURITY TFM
turns.text: Yeah, uh huh... yeah?  Oh...

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Tonight, we're going to open the green door -- the heart chakra...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I wasn't really dying, I wasn't host to cancer or parasites; I was the warm little center that the life of this world crowded around.

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: ...And you open the door and you step inside.  We're inside our hearts.  Now, imaging your pain as a white ball of healing light.  That's right, the pain itself is a ball of healing light.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: -- But, in here, in everyone, there's the squint of a five-day headache. Yet they forced themselves to be positive.  They never said "parasite;" they said "agent."  They always talked about getting better.

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Okay, everyone.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If I did have a tumor, I'd name it Marla.  Marla...the little scratch on the roof of your mouth that would heal if only you could stop tonguing it, but you can't.

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Now, find your power animal.

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Tell the other person how you feel.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're a tourist.  I saw you at melanoma, tuberculosis and testicular cancer.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: One minute.  This is the beginning.  We're at ground zero.  Maybe you should say a few words, to mark the occasion.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... i... ann....iinn.. ff....nnyin...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: It's getting exciting now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That old saying, how you always hurt the one you love, well, it works both way.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We have front row seats for this Theater of Mass Destruction.  The Demolitions Committee of Project Mayhem wrapped the foundation columns of ten buildings with blasting gelatin.  In two minutes, primary charges will blow base charges, and those buildings will be reduced to smoldering rubble.  I know this because Tyler knows this.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Look what we've accomplised.  Thirty seconds.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Somehow, I realize all of this -- the gun, the bombs, the revolution -- is really about Marla Singer.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Two, equal parts gasoline and diet cola.  Three, dissolve kitty-litter in gasoline until the mixture is thick.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pardon me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is how I met --

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Tyler Durden.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You know why they have oxygen masks on planes?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, supply oxygen?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Oxygen gets you high.  In a catastrophic emergency, we're taking giant, panicked breaths...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you do, Tyler?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I mean -- for a living.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why?  So you can say, "Oh, that's what you do." -- And be a smug little shit about it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You see, when you travel, everything is small, self-contained--

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The spork.  I get it.  You're very clever.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: How's that working out for you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Being clever.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, uh... great.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Keep it up, then.  Keep it right up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You buy furniture.  You tell yourself: this is the last sofa I'll ever need.  No matter what else happens, I've got the sofa issue handled.  Then, the right set of dishes.  The right dinette.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This is how we fill up our lives.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: And, now it's gone.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All gone.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Could be worse.  A woman could cut off your penis while you're asleep and toss it out the window of a moving car.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's always that.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I don't know, maybe I'm wrong.  Maybe it's a terrible tragedy.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I mean, you did lose a lot of nice, neat little shit.  The trendy paper lamps, the Euro-trash shelving unit, am I right?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: But maybe, just maybe, you've been delivered.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Delivered from Swedish furniture.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Delivered from armchairs in obscure green stripe patterns.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Delivered from Martha Stewart.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Delivered from bullshit colors like "Cobalt," "Ebony," and "Fuchsia."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Insurance'll cover it.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Oh, yeah, you gotta start making the list.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What list?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The "now I get to go out and buy the exact same stuff all over again" list.  That list.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't... think so.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This time maybe get a widescreen TV. You'll be occupied for weeks.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I have to file a claim...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: The things you own, they end up owning you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't I?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Do what you like.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: God, it's late.  I should find a hotel...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: A hotel?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: So, you called me up, because you just wanted to have a drink before you... go find a hotel?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't follow...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We're on our third pitcher of beer. Just ask me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You called me so you could have a place to stay.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why don't you cut the shit and ask if you can stay at my place?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Would that be a problem?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Is it a problem for you to ask?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can I stay at your place?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Yes, you can.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You're welcome.  But, I want you to do me one favor.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I want you to hit me as hard as you can.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I want you to hit me as hard as you can.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: They're called "cigarette burns."

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's called a "changeover."  The movie goes on, and nobody in the audience has any idea.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why would anyone want this shitty job?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It affords him other interesting opportunities.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: -- Like splicing single frames from adult movies into family films.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In reel three, right after the courageous dog and the snooty cag -- who have celebrity voices -- eat out of a garbage can, there's the flash of Tyler's contribution...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: One-forty-eighth of a second.  That's how long it's up there.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No one really knows that they've seen it. But they did.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: A nice, big cock.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Only a hummingbird could have caught Tyler at work.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He was the guerrilla terrorist of the food service industry.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Don't watch.  I can't if you watch.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: ... Oh, yeah.  Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He farted on meringue; he sneezed on braised endive; and, with creme of mushroom soup, well...

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Go ahead.  Say it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You get the idea.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know about this.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I don't know, either.  I want to find out.  I've never been hit, have you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  That's a good thing, isn't it?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I don't want to die without any scars.  How much can you really know about yourself if you've never been in a fight?  Come on... you're the only person I've ever asked.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Why not you?  I'm letting you go first.  Do it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is crazy.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Alright, go crazy.  Let 'er rip.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where do you want it?  In the face?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Surprise me.
